title.narrative: SWE-2011-140 Large scale agro investments in Africa - impacts on small holder land access and food security
SWE-2011-140 Large scale agro investments in Africa - impacts on small holder land access and food security

description.narrative: There is a growing trend to allocate large areas of land to investors for food and energy production in Africa. The World Bank estimates that close to 6 million ha of land are required each year until 2030 for biofuel production only. However, when it comes to house hold level impacts of this relatively new phenomenon, little empirical evidence exists. This research will look at the example of large scale biofuel production in Tanzania. The focus will be on house hold and village level impacts on food production, food prices and nutritional levels as well as wage and contractual labour as a way of offsetting economic and social exclusion. The results will also be applicable for a wider understanding of local impacts of large scale land acquisition for agro development. Thus, it can contribute to the enhancement of positive impacts and mitigation of negative impacts in future investments.

There is a growing trend to allocate large areas of land to investors for food and energy production in Africa. The World Bank estimates that close to 6 million ha of land are required each year until 2030 for biofuel production only. However, when it comes to house hold level impacts of this relatively new phenomenon, little empirical evidence exists. This research will look at the example of large scale biofuel production in Tanzania. The focus will be on house hold and village level impacts on food production, food prices and nutritional levels as well as wage and contractual labour as a way of offsetting economic and social exclusion. The results will also be applicable for a wider understanding of local impacts of large scale land acquisition for agro development. Thus, it can contribute to the enhancement of positive impacts and mitigation of negative impacts in future investments.
